lexUnit.name: burn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be entirely possessed by (a desire or emotion).

sentence.text: He wanted above all to know that he still lay safe and quiet in his nameless grave ; he was heavy and burning at heart with his longing to ask , but he would not .
The desire burning inside her was too strong , and she returned his kiss , hearing him moan at her response .
The flame that had been burning inside her since their first kiss burst suddenly into flame .
She gave a jerky nod , trying to combat her jealousy , knowing it was unreasonable , unjust , yet feeling it burn inside her , unstoppable and intolerable .
From behind him came the hubbub of the powerful men who would project him into 10 Downing Street , fulfilling the dream which had burned inside him all these years .
But the enthusiasm which burned inside Imre Pozsgay when he joined the party at the age of 17 has been extinguished by the bitter experiences of the past 40 years .
She shifted restlessly in her seat once more , imagining she could actually feel the angry pinpoint of fire burning deep inside her womb .
But , even at 40 , he still burns with ambition to dump Indy racing and make a Grand Prix come-back .
His soul burned with a righteous fury over the injustice of it all .
Burning with impatience , Jurnet waited while the coach driver left his seat and joined the four young women who were helping the passengers to alight .
It has to be , you think , the product of a group of pained souls , shadowy wordsmiths burning with intensity , desperate to communicate their anger and their enthusiasm .
Helen , climbing the stairs , burned with a curious mixture of exaltation and foreboding .
Zacco was told and threw himself , burning with zeal , into the new plans .
The social gospel is best preached by someone who burns with zeal rather than sexual desire and has espoused God alone .
